intro: Triandra pellabergensis, commonly known as the Bergberg's triandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that display a range of colors from white to pink. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in areas with moderate to high rainfall. Its leaves are usually narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
